file_content.text: You should not have brought me here, little Sith.
You may have bound my will, but such bonds can be broken, and make no mistake: I will devour you.
By the time we are done, you will have fed to excess.
There're better things to eat.
My hunger is never slaked, and you are no Tulak Hord. But I will serve you faithfully, my master, until I am free.
I'll enjoy beating you again.
You are my servant now--you will speak when spoken to, and not before.
Silence, monster.
I look forward to ripping those words from your delicious throat.
I never thought I'd say this, but you have proven most remarkable.
It would be a pleasure to serve you, at least until I manage to get into a Sith body again.
Then I hope that day never comes.
Don't count on it.
At last, you've learned your place.
Bow to me.
I'm honored to hear you say it.
Thank you.
Let's not waste any time. There is knowledge to be had, power to be stolen.
You are the heir of Tulak Hord. Your strength is great. I will guard your legacy forever.
I am most grateful.
Thank you.
I feel you'd be more likely to eat them.
Are you sure?
You are the finest shadow-killer I've ever met.
I'm honored.
Come, let's feast on our enemies.
Excellent. This Rakata box is key to the ritual. Even one as Force-resistant as Khem won't be able to resist the box's pull.
He will be imprisoned, and I will finally have this wonderful body to myself.
One more thing: Once the ritual has begun, I need you to give me as much of your power as you can so I can resist the box's pull. Understood?
I've done some crazy things, but this still makes no sense to me.
No. This is insane.
But whatever you do, make sure I am in control. Otherwise, you will ruin the ritual.
I don't like this.
Won't any power I give to you also go to Khem?
Won't Khem use the power, too?
Once the ritual starts, our spirits will be separate enough that it shouldn't matter, as long as I maintain control.
Now, let's get started.
[Zash concentrates intently, beginning the ritual.]
Yes, it's working. The box is activating. I can feel its pull.
Witch! You will not win so easily.
The monster's too strong. Quick, give me your power, or I'll be pulled in.
Here you go.
Of course.
Don't give up.
I hope this works.
[You feel some of your energy drain into the Dashade, empowering Zash.]
Yes! Out with you, monster.
Sith! What are you doing? You are helping the usurper! The witch!
I'm sorry, Khem, but Zash is so much more useful than you.
Yes, I am. [Do nothing]
You are too trusting, monster.
Shut up. [Do nothing]
Aggghhh!
Thank you, my lord. I thought he'd never leave.
Now, I believe this shipment also contained some very valuable items. Ah, this should suit you.
The first of many. We will do great things together.
I'm helping both of you. I want to see you two fight it out.
I can help you too.
[More of your energy drains into the Dashade.]
Do you really think I'm that stupid?
No. [Do nothing]
No! I'll kill you. You will regret this!
What kind of trick is this? I can't resist its pull!
Here have my strength.
Let me help.
Hold on tight.
Keep fighting.
[You feel some of your energy drain into the Dashade, empowering Khem Val.]
Thank you, my master.
No, what are you doing? We had a deal!
You underestimate my master, witch. Your snares are worthless, your schemes are nothing.
Aggghhh!
Is she really trapped?
Is that it?
I thought she'd never leave.
Finally.
I can't say I'm not sorry to see her go.
I'll miss her.
At last, my body is my own again.
The truth is, I'd rather see the two of you fight for it.
Not my problem. [Do nothing]
You have to choose one of us, or we'll both be pulled in!
No, witch! You will be pulled in. I am Khem Val, servant of Tulak Hord, conqueror of Yn and Chabosh. And you are trapped.
Is she really gone?
Is that it?
Yes, at last. The witch is gone.
I have to say, I'm impressed.
Well done.
I told you I would crush her.
I was hoping Zash would win.
You won? Bummer.
She could not win. She was weak!
Let's shoot this accursed box out the air lock and go.
My master, the moment approaches. The lady's schemes are coming to their conclusion. I can sense her excitement.
Grant me your promise that you will help me defeat her. She must not complete the ritual to banish me.
You have my word.
I promise.
I will do my best.
I'll try.
Thank you, my master. I await my liberation.
I won't make a promise I can't keep.
No deal.
You take the witch's side after all she's done! You'd better hope she succeeds.
Relentless beast. Quickly, while I have the upper hand: I have finished the work on my ritual.
There is only one more piece required. Will you help?
It's my honor to serve you.
Of course.
Why should I help you?
What will you give me?
The storehouse you saw was only a sampling of the powerful items I possess. Can Khem Val offer you that?
Tell me what this ritual entails.
What do I need to do?
I guess I'll help you, then.
All right, I accept.
Now you're speaking my language.
That's what I like to hear.
You will owe me dearly for this.
This will incur a debt.
We all have to make compromises. If I had it my way, I certainly wouldn't stay in this body.
The ritual I propose requires one more thing: a Rakata box. A sort of mental prison employed by the ancient Rakatan Infinite Empire.
One of these boxes has recently been discovered on Taris of all places. It's being transported off the planet soon. We must recover it.
I'll set a course for Taris right away.
Of course.
What's the box for?
Why the Rakata box?
I'll explain once we've recovered it.
How you manage to keep abreast of galactic discoveries is beyond me.
Your knowledge is amazing.
Believe me, your friend Khem has made it a challenge.
Hurry, we must intercept the box at the Taris space station. The ritual can't be performed without it.
My master, the witch is quiet, but I am uneasy. She is scheming something, I think.
Like the visions of Tulak Hord's remains she sent to lure me into her trap, her silence is a lie.
She is tormenting you, making you too paranoid to rest.
Don't let her do this.
What am I supposed to do? She slinks in the darkness, just out of view, always plotting, always scheming.
If she can put visions in your mind, can't you see what she's thinking?
She sounds too powerful.
The lady hides from me. I pursue, and she places snares in my path.
If I could just sink my teeth into her, she would not escape my grasp. Master, I require your help. I need to know what she's planning.
Let me talk to her. Perhaps I can learn something.
I could try speaking to her.
Yes, my master. But no tricks, or you will both die the first chance I get.
What do you suggest I do?
How can I help?
Speak to her. She doesn't think you are worthy of her intellect. You can trick her into showing her hand.
It'll be my pleasure.
Of course.
No tricks, or you will both die the first chance I get.
You would trust me to do that?
Are you sure?
You have bound me, but you are not the invader in my mind.
And how do you suggest I do that?
What's your plan?
I have seen you charm and coerce the most unwilling informants. Do what you must.
If you're not clever enough to defeat Zash on your own, that's your problem.
Then figure it out yourself.
You're never happy, are you?
Always complaining.
No, my master. Not until I'm free of this parasite.
I thought he'd never relent. He has been unusually stubborn lately. I can barely get a word in edgewise.
He thinks you're plotting against him.
He's wary of you.
He's no fool, I'll give him credit for that.
Perhaps this is fate's way of mocking me.
I can't wait for him to be gone for good.
I'm sick of him.
Then we may both be in luck.
That explains why it's been so quiet around here.
I haven't missed you.
Apprentice, I mean, my lord. Haven't we had enough? I admit you have the better of me.
It's clear the two of us can't share this body for much longer. One of us must win, and I don't intend to lose. But I need your help.
What do you need me to do?
Help?
Nothing at the moment, but soon.
You're not jumping into my body again, forget it.
No way I'm helping you.
No, you're too powerful now. Too well-known. The switch would be too obvious.
If it'll shut Khem up, I'm all for it.
I'm listening.
You have always been so helpful.
I believe I can replicate Tulak Hord's ritual without the help of the artifact. It won't be an exact copy, and whoever gets cast out will die.
When the time comes, I'll need you to convince Khem Val to go quietly.
That's easier said than done.
I'll see what I can do.
I trust you'll think of something.
It will be my pleasure.
Of course.
Excellent. I will let you know when I know more.
And why exactly should I help you and not him?
Make me an offer.
Because I can offer you knowledge and power. Khem Val is just a grunt.
Witch! She plans to drive me away with a ritual! I'll have her throat!
Thank you, master, for showing me her schemes. If you will excuse me, I must prepare my resistance.
Sith, you are more powerful than I had judged. Perhaps, a worthy successor to Tulak Hord.
Perhaps? Khem Val, stick with me and I'll show you wonders Tulak Hord never dreamed.
I'm definitely worthy.
I am ever watchful.
Well, don't lay it on so thick. It might go to my head.
How grudging of you.
Thank you, Khem. I'm honored.
I'm humbled.
I have not crushed so many since that time. I feel my old strength returning.
Yes, thank you, apprentice. This body has some remarkable abilities. I'm beginning to rather enjoy it.
Go away, Zash. Now.
Get out of here.
That's not very polite, after all I've done for you. You're nothing without me, and you know it.
Not in such a hurry to leave now, are you?
Planning to stick around?
I miss some things, but there's something exhilarating about such raw, monstrous strength.
For the last time, I'm not your apprentice.
Don't call me "apprentice."
Not now, no. But you can't suppress the order of things.
Away, witch. Sith, free me of this woman and my strength will be yours, eternally.
Please order your monster to settle down. His raging makes it impossible to get any reading done!
I will not settle down! This is my body, my strength, and you are the intruder!
My master, how could you let this witch weaken me?
You were the one who couldn't just leave Tulak Hord's bones alone.
It was your choice.
The fool will never accept responsibility as long as there's someone else to blame.
She went through all that trouble, it felt wrong to deny her the satisfaction.
She out-played you.
I thank you for your indulgence. It's not easy to plant visions in a mind like that.
My apologies. I didn't realize the consequences would be so dire.
I'm sorry, Khem.
Your apologies are wasted, it seems.
I really am quite grateful. You have no idea how much easier it's been to think since the storehouse.
And I have to say I'm growing used to this body. It has its limitations certainly, but such strength.
I'm glad you're enjoying yourself.
You seem to be having fun.
And I appreciate your help, my lord.
That's a shame, because the first chance I get, you're out and Khem is in.
Don't gloat.
A pity, because there are many more storehouses with many more valuable things. They could all be yours.
Don't get too settled. Khem won't like it.
Khem won't let you win.
He doesn't have much of a choice, does he?
Now, if you'll excuse me, I have to get some research in while the monster's at bay.
Sith, I will never forgive you for destroying Tulak Hord's bones, but you showed your strength in opposing Zash. For that, you have my loyalty.
I only did what was best for you.
You would've been weakened.
I cannot thank you for it.
Don't get so excited. I only did it to annoy you.
I didn't do it for you.
Then your time will come.
I'll die before I let Zash win.
Zash will fail.
As will I.
I cannot help but wonder what she is scheming. I won't believe any more visions.
Now I must stop and consider every stray thought. Was it really mine? Or was it that witch's?
Is her hold really that strong?
She can't possibly do that.
How should I know? I don't dare take the risk.
I promise, I'll find a way to fix things.
I'll help you.
Thank you, my master.
You can't let her get the upper hand.
You have to fight her.
I know, my master. I won't.
I fell for her tricks once, I won't fall again.
Note to self: If my apprentice's Dashade fails to submit after the transfer, the bones of Tulak Hord could prove a useful bargaining chip.
The bones of my master.
I don't know how she got hold of his remains.
I'm sorry, Khem.
I hope the witch reclaims flesh, so I may torment her as she has tormented me.
What are you waiting for? Take them and let's get out of here.
Get them and let's go.
I can't.
I promise, I won't let Zash get away with this.
Zash will pay for this.
It will not be enough to devour her. She will suffer.
The sarcophagus that holds Tulak Hord's bones is trapped with the same dark energies that bound me in Naga Sadow's tomb. I feel them.
The witch has trapped me. If I recover the bones, I will be too weak to resist her. But I cannot leave those bones with her.
Whatever you do, you can't let Zash take control.
You can't let her weaken you.
They're just bones.
Let it go.
No, I can't leave my master's remains to be defiled in the witch's possession.
I am still Tulak Hord's servant. I would give him my life; I will give him my strength.
I'm so sick of hearing about Tulak Hord.
I'd welcome Zash right now.
Then stay out of my way.
I'm sorry, Khem, but this is for your own good.
No. [Destroy the bones]
Tulak Hord's bones! Do you realize what you have done! I will devour you!
You can't let Zash win with her tricks.
It was a trap.
She is no one. I don't fear her!
Tulak Hord is long gone. You bow to me now.
I'm your master now.
That is a title you have usurped in my moment of weakness. You will fall in time.
You will thank me for it later.
You owe me.
Thank you? I will kill you.
Take me back to the ship. I will not forget this.
It's no matter to me either way.
Do what you must.
Thank you, my master.
Take the bones. I won't let Zash win.
Then don't.
You're right. The witch must not win.
Aggghhh!
Ah, that's better. I can think so much more clearly now. Thank you.
Khem Val will tear you apart, and I look forward to watching.
You're not going to win.
Now, now. There's no need to be bitter.
He was starting to get on my nerves.
You're welcome.
It's my pleasure to help.
One more trick like this and you'll be punished.
You get one warning.
I promise, I'll be a good girl from now on.
This is my storehouse, you may have anything here you want.
Now let's go back to the ship, shall we? I don't know how long Khem will be weakened, and I have lots of reading to catch up on.
Entering storehouse 0026. Antiquities: Tulak Hord era.
The witch will pay. I will cast her into the body of a kath hound and devour her.
I will feel her bones crunch between my teeth, and I will laugh.
This is too much of a coincidence.
It has to be a trap.
The witch will pay for her tricks.
I'm sure there's a perfectly reasonable explanation for this.
Don't rush to conclusions.
Do not defend her, little Sith. Or you will be devoured as well.
Save some for me, will you?
I'm with you.
Of course, my master.
Tulak Hord's body has been taken. I must reclaim it.
How would you know that?
Are you sure?
It was revealed to me, just as before. In a vision.
Is this another one of your nightmares?
You had another vision.
Yes, more vivid than before.
I don't see what the big deal is.
It's just bones.
It is Tulak Hord! Conqueror of Yn and Chabosh! Others are flesh and bone, but Tulak Hord is death incarnate!
The bones are in a storehouse on Hoth, where the thief took them. I saw it clearly.
I am going to reclaim them, whether you will it or not.
I helped you defeat Veshikk Urk, I'll help you find Tulak Hord's bones.
You have my aid.
You go nowhere without me.
I will follow.
Then assist me, or I will free myself from your binding by force.
It's no use arguing with you when you get like this. Let's go.
Let's get this over with.
Thank you, my master.
I have been having disturbing visions, little Sith. Waking nightmares.
A stranger creeps into Tulak Hord's resting place and disturbs his sleep. It is an ill omen.
Lots of strangers enter that tomb, Khem. It's used to train acolytes.
I'm sure it's nothing.
Tulak Hord hid his burial chamber to keep prying hands away from his place of rest.
What do you expect me to do about it?
Why tell me?
I wonder what it's an omen of.
What do you think it means?
Tulak Hord is warning his most faithful servant.
His tomb may be stripped bare of its treasures, but I will not allow his grave to be defiled!
I wouldn't trust every stray thought that enters your mind, especially with Zash in there.
Be careful what you believe.
That witch has no power over me.
It's been hundreds of years and no one's discovered his burial chambers.
I'm sure it's alright.
I will not ignore the portent of what I saw.
I'll look into it when I get the chance.
Neither will I.
Thank you, my master.
I will devour anyone who dares approach that grave.
Enough. Finally. A reprieve from that monster.
Apprentice, I promise--get me out of this infernal body and I will give you power like you can't imagine.
You've made that promise before, and look how it turned out.
How can I trust you?
I don't see what you have to complain about.
That body is the perfect match for your personality.
I think it rather suits you.
Yes, yes. "Zash is a monster." Very clever.
If I get you out of this body, it'll be to kill you.
You'll die first.
At least we can finally be frank with each other.
I very nearly changed my mind about the ritual, you know. I genuinely like you. But it was that or death, and I don't like anyone that much.
Then you'll understand why I didn't go without a fight. It was that or death....
Me neither.
I trained you too well, I think.
Well, that makes everything okay.
That's meant to reassure me?
Don't be a poor sport. Surely you're used to how this works by now?
So, which of you is the rock and which is the hard place? Khem Val wants to eat me; what do you want?
You and Khem are bad news.
If I can't have out of this body, the least you can do is ensure that the monster is silenced for good.
Khem Val may be a monster who eats Force users, but he's never lied to me.
I like that monster.
I will find a way out of this body, and failing that, I will find a way to take control. There's your truth.
I'm not your apprentice anymore. I don't do your bidding.
I don't take your orders.
Then you'd best hope I don't find a way to take control on my own.
You're hardly in a place to be threatening people.
I'm not afraid of you.
What will you do to stop me?
Another word and I will cut you down right now.
I could kill you now.
And lose your precious shadow-killer? I think not.
I'm interested in seeing this threat realized. It could be entertaining.
I dare you to try.
As cocky as ever.
Remember: Kill me, and you kill your precious Khem, too.
I'll see what I can arrange.
I'll try.
You were always my favorite apprentice.
If you do not find a way to destroy this witch, I will tear every piece of this ship apart! I will devour everyone on board!
That's quite enough of you.
You did this to me, little Sith. Your silence mocks me!
She blindsided both of us.
I'm sorry, Khem Val.
I understand. Tulak Hord used whatever means he had to get his way, but I was never present for his rituals.
How was I supposed to know what would happen?
It wasn't my ritual.
The rituals of Tulak Hord are not games!
Your master meddled in something she did not understand, and now we both must suffer. Fate and fortune weave a torturous web for flies like us.
Did Tulak Hord ever switch bodies when you were with him?
Has this happened before?
No, but I was only with him a very short time before he put me to sleep.
There must be a way to get Zash out of you.
We have to undo the ritual.
If you could free me of this curse, I would follow you willingly all my days.
I'll see what I can do about it.
I'm working on it.
Thank you, my master.
Sounds tempting, but I'm not sure I could ever trust you not to eat me.
I think I'll keep you bound.
You are wise. Nevertheless, you would have my word.
I don't suppose you have any idea where to start?
Any suggestions?
I do not practice rituals of the Force. That is your domain.
I await my freedom.
If you're just going to whine, I think I'd rather talk to Zash.
That's enough of you.
[Remain silent]
Do not tempt me, Sith. It's been a long time since I've properly feasted.
My master, I have made a discovery. You remember I told you about Ortan Cela, my master's apprentice, and his Dashade slave?
I am certain that my fellow shadow assassin, Veshikk Urk, lives--that my mistress death does not yet claim him.
What makes you so certain?
Why should I care?
I ask nothing of you, my master, but if Veshikk is alive, I must find him and speak with him.
Where is he?
I received a call from a cloaked figure, the place was a vault on Tatooine that my master kept.
If Veshikk Urk is alive on Tatooine, I must find him and speak to him. He's my last connection to my master, to my life before it took this cruel turn.
Then you'd better get going.
What are you waiting for?
My master, you do not understand how the bond between us works. I cannot be long away from your side unless you free me.
We must get to Tatooine.
Let's go.
Sounds like somebody needs to learn to let go.
Stop being so sentimental.
For hundreds of years I slept, and when I awoke everything I knew was gone, but it was like only a night had passed.
I cannot go to Veshikk unless you go with me. The bond between us requires it.
I have served you faithfully, my master. I only ask that you accompany me to Tatooine to see if Veshikk Urk still lives.
It's been a while since I felt sand between my toes.
It couldn't hurt.
So be it.
Whenever you wish it, my master. I will trace the signal I received to find the exact location where Veshikk is hiding.
One monster is enough.
Forget it.
So be it, my master. But I will remember this.
My master, do not mock the cruelty of my fate. Leave me to my peace.
What are you moaning about now, monster?
Crying again?
You are right--I should not be moaning. I should be laughing.
I'm sorry you're upset. Mind telling me why?
Can I help?
I will show you cruelty, monster, if you keep using that tone with me!
Don't try my patience!
I am sorry, my master. For once, I meant no disrespect.
After our last conversation, I began to wonder what became of my rival and ally, Veshikk Urk.
That is how I found this--a Jedi record of a stasis chamber they uncovered, like the one you found me in. They say the "creature" inside was killed.
I thought you hated Veshikk Urk.
Why do you care?
We were rivals, but we were united in our service to our mistress death and to the Sith we followed.
This "creature" could have been anybody, right?
Perhaps it wasn't him.
My kind have always been few outside of our homeworld of Urkupp. Your suggestion is possible, but not likely.
It can't be easy waking up and finding all your friends dead.
I'm sorry.
I do not need sympathy from you, little Sith.
If I were free, I would hunt those Jedi relentlessly and feast on my revenge.
As it is, my only choice is to laugh at my own powerlessness. Ha!
Ah, little Sith! I had forgotten what a delight it is to roam the galaxy and feast on its energies!
I have not felt this full since the battles of Yn and Chabosh, when Veshikk Urk and I followed our masters into war and feasted on armies of Jedi!
I'm glad you're so happy.
You're welcome.
I begin to feel my old strength returning. If I am happy, it is in the knowledge that I will soon be free.
I'm not familiar with Yn or Chabosh.
Tell me about these battles.
It was in the days before Tulak Hord was Dark Lord of the Sith.
On Yn, the Jedi had laid siege to an Imperial stronghold. Tulak Hord broke the siege single-handedly!
And then he pressed forward to Jedi-held Chabosh, leaving nothing but Jedi blood in his wake. I never lacked Force to feed on in those days.
Continue to follow me, and I promise, those days will return.
It will be like that again.
I doubt you will be able to live up to those words, little Sith.
You have strange taste, my monstrous friend.
Yuck.
Do not presume to call me "friend." If I were free, we would not be speaking like this.
Get over it already.
Not so. Death is the reward of the strong. But either way, death never returns what she claims.
Still, when I fight at your side, I begin to feel like I did then, when Veshikk Urk and I fought at our masters' sides, and none could defeat us.
It is just another bitter twist of fortune that Veshikk Urk and I will never fight at our masters' sides again.
If I hear that name one more time, I'll have you put back into stasis.
Enough of Tulak Hord!
I will remember how you hate that name, when I am devouring you.
I know now who you remind me of, little Sith. His name was Ortan Cela. He was my master's apprentice.
Ortan Cela also walked with a Dashade shadow assassin--a beast called Veshikk Urk.
Don't tell me you consider yourself civilized.
Aren't you all beasts?
Every one of your insults against me will be visited upon you in time, little Sith.
He must've been pretty powerful to tame such a wild animal.
Thanks for the compliment.
It was not a compliment.
What do this Ortan Cela and I have in common?
How do I remind you of him?
Your ambition outstrips your ability, and you do not hesitate to take what you don't deserve.
Where Tulak Hord treated me as his ally, Ortan Cela treated Veshikk Urk as his animal.
Veshikk Urk was once my greatest rival in the order of the shadow assassins on Urkupp, but Cela stole his dignity and reduced him to a slavering monster.
Humiliation and torment are two of my favorite things.
Sounds like my kind of guy.
I'm sorry you think I'm cruel. I didn't intend it.
I've tried to treat you well.
You have nevertheless made me a slave.
If he had been strong, he would've killed his cruel master.
Veshikk sounds weak.
Like you, Ortan Cela bound Veshikk Urk by force. Veshikk had no choice but to accept his indignities.
I don't know what happened to Veshikk after I went into stasis, but I promise you, I will not be enslaved forever.
I have been watching you closely, my master.
You are soft and reckless with your power. Nothing like the great Tulak Hord. Is it weakness or overconfidence that lends you to such foolish mercy?
Sometimes it takes greater strength to spare an enemy than to kill him.
Mercy is not weakness.
Tulak Hord never spared anyone.
You take a casual delight in cruelty, much like the great Tulak Hord. But I think you think yourself more powerful than you actually are.
My power is greater than any of the fools that surround me.
I know my strength.
You are still nothing compared to Tulak Hord.
At least I'm not a corpse.
Tulak Hord is dead.
You will not insult the legacy of Tulak Hord.
What I do with my power is my business, slave.
Don't forget your place.
Your power over me is stolen, little Sith.
I was the greatest shadow assassin on Urkupp when Tulak Hord challenged me to honorable combat and claimed his victory.
I followed him out of honor, out of devotion. I was his ally, not his slave!
Not many people lock their allies in stasis for centuries.
Then why the cage?
Fate is cruel. Tulak Hord promised to return, but death, the mistress of all, claimed him.
But I am used to these bitter ironies. A shadow assassin is trained to laugh at life's cruelty.
Have you already forgotten about our honorable combat?
I beat you, too.
The memory of it is seared on my brain. The shame gnaws at my innards.
I will free you when I'm confident you won't eat me, Khem.
I can't trust you.
And I will never bind myself to such a promise.
Your faithful servant waits in hungry anticipation of the day he is free.
Little Sith, you try my patience.
My only consolation is knowing you will not be able to bind me forever.
You underestimate me, Khem Val.
Yes, I will.
Do you still think you'll be able to eat me?
And then what?
I think that you would hardly be worth eating, except that my pride demands it.
I'm sorry.
Every moment I am your slave is a new offense!
Know this, little Sith. When you sleep, when you eat, when you drink, whenever your full attention wanders from me, I will be watching, and I will be waiting.
I will find you weak, and I will consume you. That is my promise.
Last night I had a very good dream, little Sith.
What was the dream?
Really?
Your monstrous dreams don't interest me.
I don't care.
Ah, but it concerns you most of all.
There was a purple Jawa and seven dancing Trandoshans, balanced on a rancor's claw....
So did I!
Mock all you like, my master.
You had toppled over the edge of a very great chasm, but at the last moment, I reached in to grab you.
And as your helpless body swayed above the abyss, you pleaded with me to save you.
You let me fall into the abyss, didn't you?
And you didn't.
On the contrary.
You saved me and we both lived happily ever after, right?
Does it have a happy ending?
I don't want to know your fantasies.
You're sick.
Nevertheless, it is wrong not to finish a story once one has started telling it.
I did save you, my master. But in saving you, I became strong enough to eat you. It was a very good dream indeed.
Enough of this, little Sith!
I was once the proud servant of the great Tulak Hord. The next time you hear my voice, it will be my laughter as I devour you.
You don't scare me.
Foolish, foolish little Sith.
Calm down.
Weak. My every sinew burns at the thought of serving you.
I beat you once. I can beat you again.
Thanks for the warning.
You won't get the chance. I am a Shadow Killer. No place will be safe.
I wish to speak with you on the ship.
I wish to speak with you.
I have nothing to say to you, little Sith.
I await your command.
Next time we're on the ship, I have something to share with you.
When you have a moment, we need to talk.
I can't imagine what we'd have to say to each other right now.
Are you ready to prove yourself yet?
I hope you realize what an inconvenience this is.
If I must. [Attack]
I can't wait. [Attack]
I don't have time for your games, monster.
Not yet.
Then I will wait.
I can't imagine we have anything to talk about.
You're in charge now, apprentice. I'm just along for the ride.
Your will shall be done.
My blade grows restless.
I tire of waiting.
Who shall I devour next?
I serve. For now.
Oblivion awaits all.
Start the killing. I will finish it.
Death is always just one step behind.
When your enemies meet death, it is my face that shall greet them.
I am always watching.
The galaxy will once again fear the conqueror of Yn and Chabosh.
Strength or death. That is your way.
Words are empty. Violence speaks louder.
I follow your lead, little Sith.
I have not yet sated my hunger.
I trained you too well, I think.
You were always my favorite apprentice.
It's my pleasure to help.
I promise, I'll be a good girl from now on.
